title: Nationals release roster for wild card game
text:
The Washington Nationals announced their 25-man roster for the National League Wild Card Game against the Milwaukee Brewers.

The Nationals went with 16 hitters and just nine pitchers, only five of whom were relief pitchers during the regular season: Daniel Hudson, Tanner Rainey, Fernando Rodney, Sean Doolittle and Hunter Strickland.

Max Scherzer will start for Washington, and other starters like Stephen Strasburg or Patrick Corbin could be available to come out of the bullpen to get a few outs.

The full roster is below:

Pitchers: Patrick Corbin, Sean Doolittle, Daniel Hudson, Tanner Rainey, Fernando Rodney, Anibal Sanchez, Max Scherzer, Stephen Strasburg, Hunter Strickland

Catchers: Yan Gomes, Raudy Read, Kurt Suzuki

Infielders: Matt Adams, Asdrubal Cabrera, Brian Dozier, Howie Kendrick, Anthony Rendon, Trea Turner, Ryan Zimmerman

Outfielders: Adam Eaton, Gerardo Parra, Victor Robles, Juan Soto, Andrew Stevenson, Michael A. Taylor

Ladies and gentlemen, your 2019 Washington Nationals NL Wild Card roster.#STAYINTHEFIGHT pic.twitter.com/m2dHDFnaL9 — Washington Nationals (@Nationals) October 1, 2019
